Pre-Game Insights: After Igor Stimac’s exit as India’s head coach, the Blue Tigers aim to move beyond the pain of the past and look forward with an experienced Manolo steering the ship.
Post-Match Reflections: That was a lukewarm start from Manolo Marquez’s first starting XI as India and Mauritius go into the break without scoring.

One would assume that it was not the perfect evening for Manolo Marquez after he termed his managerial debut for India as a 'boring game', saying that the team practically created no chances throughout the 90 minutes.
The centre-back pairing of Chinglensana Singh and Rahul Bheke played an important role in keeping a clean sheet against the Mauritians.
Despite decent turnout, poor marketing underlines major issues with football fan culture in India.
Miscellaneous Highlights: India head coach Manolo Marquez reacts during the first half against Mauritius in the Intercontinental Cup in Hyderabad.
Chinglensana Singh is back in the national team setup and is raring to rekindle his partnership with Manolo for the first time since their Hyderabad FC days.
Nikhil Poojary gets some minutes in on his birthday as Asish Rai comes off.
Manolo makes another change: Apui off for Suresh in the midfield.
Others: India vs Mauritius, Intercontinental Cup LIVE stream info: Where to watch Manolo Marquez’s first match as the Blue Tigers head coach.
